pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:5.1: 10. The second training rule on lifted robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their robes lifted up. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not lift one’s robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his robe lifted on one side or both, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:10.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:10.2: The first chapter on all around is finished.
